review_title: Calm and friendly place to do research
pros: - Homeoffice - Flexible work hours - Independence
cons: Cannot think of any cons

pros: Good work life balance. Sits in a small cool city.
cons: Depending on the research group, some could be a little hard.

pros: A lot of freedom Good Ecosystem Lot of smart researchers
cons: I did not find a ny

review_title: big organization with a lot of potentials
pros: welll-funded projects in my reserach area, have the chance to teach
cons: hierarchical structure at the University level with low efficiency

job_title: Independent Research Fellow, Group Leader in Darmstadt
pros: 1. Great work-life balance 2. Amazing collaborators and research topic options
cons: 1. Sometimes stressful but not due to the university

pros: It provides flexible and remote working hours
cons: The salaries are not negotiable

review_title: Working as a researcher at TU Darmstadt
pros: The pros and cons are very much related to your professor. - Most professors are very flexible regarding working hours, and also remote working. - You don't have to know German language. - You can have Landes tickets, so you have free access to most transport vehicles in Hessen. - If you like research, it could be a good place!
cons: - In the field of computer engineering/science, you might be able to simply find a better salary. - As it lasts between 4 to 6 years of research to get a PhD degree, it might be boring after a while!

pros: Good to learn something and earn money when you study in this uni.
cons: In the end is nothing to learn.

pros: - Good communication - learning of new skills
cons: - a lot of individual responsibility

pros: Nice environment to work at but depends strongly on your professor
cons: As a PhD student, there are no cons

review_title: Good for jobs, not good for life
pros: good university and good equipments
cons: hard to find a good apartment in Darmstadt.

pros: Freedom of research Transparent Institution
cons: PhD salaries are always low with respect to the non-academic job market, but overall it is fair.

pros: Great colleagues and flexible working hours in itself, if you are willing to work 10 hours a day and more
cons: Poor management, no supervision and support for own thesis. Only tasks that allow grand proposals are assigned.

pros: Well known and High prestigious University,
cons: No good food at Mensa

pros: normal and nothing special feeling
cons: there is no river going through darstadt

review_title: Jobs are good are work experience but Job Supervisors lack professional skills
pros:
[1] Time off to write exams
[2] Jobs available in English
[3] Flexi work hours
[4] Work is good only if your Supervisor likes you. Otherwise no sense in working there
cons:
[1] Salary is too low for current rate of inflation. 
[2] Don't allow to credit your name as contributor for research projects you actually develop (Credit Hogging by others)
[3] Contract renewals can be complicated & stressful with Supervisors.
[4] Lack of professional etiquettes and work process with Supervisors

pros: repect work life balance. high tech research
cons: no cons to report about TU Darmstadt

pros: Diverse, inclusive, and encouraging atmosphere
cons: The labs can be very hot during summer

job_title: technischer Zeichner / CAD Konstrukteur in Darmstadt
pros: Flexible Time Management and Tolerance
cons: Low Payment as an undergraduate

pros:
- Lots of research areas and labs 
- Relaxed and minimal bureacracy
cons: - Less diverse than other bigger German universities

pros: Very professional work environment and good resources
cons: the teaching load is rather high

pros: Good space and facilities to work.
cons: Contracts with a limited period (less than 6 years after Ph.D.)

pros: international culture at university was very good
cons: nothing to specify .. ..

job_title: Software Engineer in Frankfurt am Main
pros: flexible, research oriented, international, children friendly
cons: burocratic, low efficiency, no permant job

pros:
Technological Knowledge and institute
Funding aquisitions.
cons:
Management and Humanresources.
Always construction.
Limited recreational facilities.

pros: i always got the salary on time
cons: no other perks given at work

pros: Research facilities are overall good.
cons: Low salary for the hard research work for both doctoral and post doc employees.

pros: There are good research facilities.
cons: There is low salary for both doctoral and post doctoral candidates.

pros: Free and flexible, first-class facilities
cons: Too free and flexible, competition for equipment resources is fierce.

review_title: I worked at UKP Lab as a NLP intern
pros:
* Nice people
* Great background in NLP
* Good infrastructure
* Up to date lab with latest trends in NLP
cons: * You should work hard and seriously

pros: Good university to work. I worked in organic chemistry and biochemistry,
cons: No major negatives, good place for PhD and postdoc

pros: high degree of job flexibility
cons: low wadges compare to oder places

review_title: flexible working time, good facilities, good faculty
pros: flexible working time, good facilities, good faculty
cons: low compensation and benifits, no bonus,

pros:
Flexible Timings
Decent pay

cons: cannt think of any cons

pros: good place to work, good reputation
cons: living cost in darmstadt is quite expensive

pros: Relaxed working environment. Caring supervisors.
cons: Nothing is permanent here. Please move very often.

pros: Big variety of technological research activities.
cons: Highly focussed on engineering, computer science, etc. Departments for law, literature, history ... are very small.

pros: people can really learn things by helping the professors or colleges doing researches.
cons: Sometimes the work is boring, but there must be someone doing it. That will be you.

pros: Very good work place, good colleagues, good boss
cons: No real negatives in here

pros: Very good infrastructure and working environment
cons: German language for communication with people can be a barrier sometimes

pros: Everything was good and fun. Worked on challenging projects.
cons: There are no downsides if the professor is good.

review_title: Research group makes all the difference
pros: Fairly standard bureaucracy for a German university.  What matters is the particular research group you are part of.  I was part of a very high quality group working under a talented professor.  The professor was granted enough independence by the university to run an effective group.
cons: If you have a disagreement with your professor, the university does not consider it proper to intervene, so it's up to you to work things out or leave, so choose your professor wisely.

review_title: Everything is good, It is much better, If I can speak Germany.
pros: Professor Jürgen Rödel’s group is a world-leader not only in research of lead-free piezoceramics but also in the field of fatigue for piezoceramics. I am very glad to have the chance to work with Prof. Rodel.
cons: It is difficult to find an apartment for rent, especially for foreigners. Also the rent is very expensive, compared with other cities in Germany.

review_title: Great technical university in an great area
pros: One of the leading universities in engineering in Germany. I can recommend the computer science department.
cons: The current management does not support the typical academic employee participation enough.

pros: Quite a lot of freedom. The funding of the university is sufficient. At least in Germany the university is probably quite popular among employers.
cons: Not a major research institution internationally. No structured PhD program.Communication between different chairs and departments hardly available.

pros: work-life balance, good career chances, many chances to have collaboration with other colleagues in other departments, expertise can be improved
cons: pressure to publish papers is rather high, there are many time with concurrent projects, administrative stuff is also an issue

review_title: Freedom of work with lots of future career opportunities
pros:
- Flexible working hours
- Family-friendly
- Free use of local transportation (Hessen ticket)
- Strong support programs for technology transfer
cons: - Connection to the industry and researchers all around the world could be improved.

review_title: Great for Computer Science PhD students
pros:
Top class faculty.

Almost industry standard salary (around 2000 EUR after taxes) if you're employed on a full-time contract in CS or Engineering.

Close to Frankfurt.
cons: Not much social life without really knowing German.

review_title: One of the best in Germany for doctoral research
pros: The university offers much helpful support including the welcome center (for international students), language courses, etc.
cons: The physical facilities are somewhat poor.

pros: Good environment for work, very flexible working time.
cons: A lot of responsibilities on student supervision, teaching, and so on.

pros: Lots of freedom, flexible working time, good working environment.
cons: Low salary, depends on professor, could be asked to involve in too much industry projects.

review_title: Great environment for research and teaching
pros: Definitely recommended work place, you receive excellent support on your research and teaching!!!
cons: Food options at the Mensa are sub par.

pros: Times are flexible, administrative things are easily done when on the PhD level
cons: Expected to work 10-14 hours a day before deadlines

pros: Flexible working hours, international work environment.
cons: Not successful in the most recent Excellence Initiative. Administration must be more foreigner-friendly.

pros: interesting research areas, chance to learn many simulation tools
cons: less experiments, too much theory

pros: Good research environment, flexible timing, friendly and multicultural colleagues.
cons: Nothing that I can think of at the moment.

pros: Lot's of interesting projects and collaborators.
cons: Lack of rooms, research ethics concerns between the groups.

pros: good sports center. Good equipments.
cons: Rigid beurocracy, Bad food caffeteria and Mensa

pros: Lot of diversity and many free facilities for students
cons: Limited choices in selecting projects

pros: flexibility, relax, freedom, intercultural, international
cons: salary, job insecurity, long working hours, slow system
